I could, but I don't plan to, as I don't think that will fit well with the games direction.

Ship building is meant to take place in space docks (in space), in launch bays (at ground facilities) and finally from your ship itself (if the right parts are on your ship) you can build your ship from your ship if you have the required materials. 

The ground facilities with launch bays is the nearest to what you were talking about I think. However the player will build or edit their ship in the launch bay and simply launch from the bay when finished.

Perhaps one of the biggest ways this game has change from Asteroid Initiative is that "your" ship becomes much more personal to you. You build it, add to it, upgrade parts, repair damage parts, remove outdated parts. It is your player's home. You will be able to walk around inside certain parts and attach smaller ships to our main ship.

Your ship is special!

As you would expect the planets surround the star at the center of each solar system. And planets can have moons as well. Currently planets and moons do not orbit, and this may or may not change. I would like to have orbiting planets, but this could cause some extra complications for the game that do not really add to the enjoyment.

The game is less about your delta V and orbital characteristics and more about exploring and surviving.

The planets of the starting star system resemble our solar system's planets. But because of the scale of the game and planets it would be awkward to make a mini earth as the continents would not make any sense. Since when does Africa have a massive cave you can fly a spaceship into... Well it doesn't, but in the game there are big caves you can fly down into, which are spread around the surface of the earth like planet and many others. The earth like is about 1200 meters in diameter. Which sounds pretty small, but it still gives lots of area to explore.

I tested it out, and it's pretty fun.  I don't know if you're aware about this bug, but if you launch a ship, go back, and try to build another, it spawns the parts below the left panel in the building UI, and doesn't allow you to move them.

Hey everyone, I finally got ship building to a mostly complete state, (It had was lacking clipping blocking, so you could place parts in parts). I got a lot done in the damage system, which has been a big headache. Damaging parts is easy enough, but the things that need to happen when a parts breaks is a little more complex. For instance if a part had other parts connected to it that were not destroyed but are not visibly connected to the main section of the spaceship, they need to be set free from the main section and so on. Since I am using my own system for ship parts being connected (not using Unity3D's physics system for connections) and since parts can have multiple attachment points, this tends to get pretty complex quickly. I do feel like I got the most complex portion of it done though.

So next time I make a build available you should have spaceships that can fall apart!

I also started a blog to keep track of my development for anyone who is interested. [http://www.davidtdesign.com/blog](http://www.davidtdesign.com/blog)
